DataElement.preferredName: Person Radiology Disease or Disorder Evaluation Prior Registration Diagnostic Imaging Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether the systematic, objective appraisal of any method that uses a visual display of structural or functional patterns of organs or tissues using radiation (such as x-rays) or other imaging technologies to examine the inside of the body prior to registration to diagnose any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person has been performed as an element of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Radiology Disease or Disorder Evaluation Prior Registration Diagnostic Imaging Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the systematic, objective appraisal of any method that uses a visual display of structural or functional patterns of organs or tissues using radiation (such as x-rays) or other imaging technologies to examine the inside of the body prior to registration to diagnose any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person as an elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Property.preferredName: Radiology Disease or Disorder Evaluation Prior Registration Diagnostic Imaging Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: The use of radiation (such as x-rays) or other imaging technologies (such as ultrasound and magnetic resonance imaging) to diagnose or treat disease.:Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.:Evaluation; the act of placing value on something.:Earlier in time or order.:The act of listing or recording officially; officially qualified or enrolled.:Any method that uses a visual display of structural or functional patterns of organs or tissues for diagnostic evaluation..:Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: The branch of medical science dealing with the medical use of X-rays or other penetrating radiation.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.
Systematic, objective appraisal of the significance, effectiveness, and impact of activities or condition according to specified objectives and criteria.
The act of listing or recording officially; officially qualified or enrolled.
Any method that uses a visual display of structural or functional patterns of organs or tissues for diagnostic evaluation.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Tumor <=3 cm maximum diameter
ReferenceDocuments.description: Tumor <=3 cm maximum diameter, clinical stage Ia or selected Ib (i.e., with visceral pleural involvement) by PET/CT scan of the chest and upper abdomen performed within 60 days prior to registration.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Tumor <=4 cm maximum diameter, including clinical stage Ia or selected Ib by PET/CT scan of the chest and upper abdomen performed within 60 days prior to registration

DataElement.changeDescription: Replaced VD Eligibility Ind-2 2018257v1 with VD ID#3506068 - Yes No Indicator - dbw
